rComments: Awesome teacher, I learned a lot. She always kept the class interesting. Her tests were fair and weren't too hard. It's a shame she doesn't teach at UCSC anymore.

One of the best professors I've had yet. Funny, interesting, knowledgeable and an overall great lecturer. Very understanding, accommodating, and helpful but not a pushover; clearly cares about students and wants them to succeed. Sad that she's leaving.

Maybe it's because she's Latina, but I loved her! She was funny, kept the class interesting and was clear on her topics. IF you just study (make your own study guides) the tests are passable. All there is to the class is a midterm and final +lab work in sections.

Professor Juarez is an amazing  professor. Her material is difficult, but I learned a lot more than I had ever hoped for in Human Evolution. She is a great lecturer, has energetic personality, and super helpful during office hours. You'll be lucky if you ever have the chance of taking her class.

Chelsey was a great professor. She was serious about her anthropology and expected you to do the work but she was always helpful and kept the class interesting. Lectures are intriguing and definitely not boring.
I've taken too many Chelsea classes to count. She's an amazing professor with a lot of passion for her subject. Extremely hard class, but totally worth it!

By far the most difficult class I have ever taken, but also the most rewarding. Requires AT LEAST 10 hours per week in the lab working with bones, but more like 20 to do well, plus time at home. Take Human Anatomy before this course, it will help immensely. Go to office hours, Chelsey is awesome and will do whatever she can to help students succeed

Juarez is very articulate. The class has a lot of subject material, but Juarez is always able to help. Class is also very entertaining, but be ready for a fair amount of studying. She says to use her lecture notes first and the text only if you really don't understand. Provides a solid foundation for upper-div anthro classes.

Dr. Juarez is an amazing teacher.  She makes the class laugh and took us on a fun field trip as well.  I highly recommend taking her class.  Her tests are kind of hard, but if you study it does pay off, & she's very clear on what will be on the test.  I would take another one of her classes again.

Her class was very difficult, I failed every single quiz but I got an A+ on the final so she gave me a passing grade. I love the way she teaches. Her classes are challenging but they;however, you feel a great amount of satisfaction with what you learned. She is very funny and provides students with some interesting facts about the subject.

Chelsey was very funny! A lot more exciting than some other professors. She's also very passionate about her subject, which is nice to see! Her tests are hard though, and lectures are definitely important if you want to pass them. The book is barely used, and there is no study guides. I enjoyed the class though, it was good.

Chelsey is amazing, and this class really helped to solidify my goals for the future. Her lectures are fast-paced and intense, but worth it. She has a very dry sense of humor, but never failed to make me laugh. Her exams were HARD, but studying for them was easily done with flashcards. This class was amazing.

Chelsea is great! She is clear, concise and makes the class enjoyable. Her tests are pretty difficult. There is no study guide and you have to attend class every day to know what will be on it. She is clear in class on what to expect, but otherwise you're screwed.

She loves what she is teaching. This makes her classes interesting and fun. She is clearly knowledgeable and easy to approach. Her tests are hard so you HAVE to study, but it pays off! Luckily she is a little late most days, and I am NEVER on time, so it works out well.

Her lectures are informative and interesting. She's a tough grader and the content is difficult to grasp for persons unfamiliar with the subject but the end result is very rewarding. The main trouble I had with the class was her lateness. She would post material late if at all, and she arrived at our final exam and most class lectures late as well

I have had Chelsea for many classes and have been to her office hours many times. She respects hard work above everything, but there is no harm in getting to know her (despite outward appearances). She is clearly extremely knowledgable and talented, but is not the most organized or timely professor. Her Osteology class was the best I'd ever taken.
Extremely intelligent and a great teacher but she is full of herself and rude. Unless you want to be part of her stuck-up posse skip the personal interaction and keep it on a professor-student level.

Very into her subjects and gets really into the material. Does a great job of helping students and seems to enjoy the class. Fun class but there wasn't a section, mandatory attendance, participation, or homework points available- so you only have a midterm & final for your grade, which were fairly easy & short. Plus, field trips! Highly recommend.

The lectures are intense but interesting. She's an outstanding teacher outside of her lateness - still waiting for a paper prompt to be posted which should have been 4 days ago & always shows up last minute to lectures. She's a busy person for sure, but, still, she needs to work on her inability to post things up when she says she will.

Great lecturer, but she is EXTREMELY disorganized. She showed up late to the 1st exam, changed the point value of some of the questions after the test, and even recorded my score incorrectly. If you are willing to gamble with your GPA, her class is a very good opportunity to learn a lot. Take notes on everything she says and review regularly.

Chelsey is the best professor I have ever taken at UCSC!She is extremely helpful and goes out of her way if you go visit her in her office.Her class is challenging as well as her test but it is amazing all you can learn in 10 weeks. The forensic report was useful yet we should have worked in groups on that. Highly recommend to take a class with her

Chelsey's classes are definitely tough, but she is very fair and clear on what you must know (and do) to succeed in the class. She is extremely knowledgeable and will go out of her way to help you understand the material. Many hours may be spent per week in the lab, but that is what's necessary in order for anyone to succeed in these courses.

Probably one of the best classes taken here but also the most difficult so far. 10+ hours (no joke) in the lab outside of class to pass quizzes weekly. Still the class is VERY rewarding. Chelsey comes off very intimidating but is willing to help in office hours (sign up early!) She was half an hour late for the final though =[
